Description: Rectangular wooden writing-board with demotic writing: Receipt Concerning Telestikon (tax priests paid upon assuming office). In the text we find the name Pareitis.
Curator's comments: Kaplony-Heckel spuriously suggests (1995) that it originates from Gebelein; Text reads: Regnal year 35, Pachon, Day 4 of Caesar, telestikon (tax) … through Pareitis (?) at places … deben 12, kite 5 again (?) on this day Other Reference: Kaplony-Heckel 1995 p. 46 n. 30
Bibliographic references: Brunsch 1982-83 / Acht Holztafeln aus dem Britischen Museum, London (no. 4, 36-36.)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (51862)
Subjects: commerce/finance (Receipt, telestikon (tax priests paid upon assuming office))
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
